Posted By: FragNutMK1 (3/22/2010 3:23:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
**Card --**  
  
The Ankh of Mishra is an ok card, although the main problem is that if you play it too early you suffer just as much as your opponents. You may think you have enough lands, until you want to cast more spells in a turn! In my early days, I built some kind of burn deck with this in it. I really could've used that last lightning bolt. It has its uses, but overall I'd rather just use something else. Even in Land destruction!  
  
3.5/5
posts.html:

The Ankh of Mishra is an ok card, although the main problem is that if you play it too early you suffer just as much as your opponents. You may think you have enough lands, until you want to cast more spells in a turn! In my early days, I built some kind of burn deck with this in it. I really could've used that last lightning bolt. It has its uses, but overall I'd rather just use something else. Even in Land destruction!

3.5/5

Posted By: Couchman (12/21/2011 10:07:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Commenting on Every Card this Weekend! :D And commenting on Alpha cards really is fun. I need to eventually Draft Alpha. heck I don't care if you take the Power out-- Alpha Magic is just Cool and Fun even without $1000 dollar cards! :O  
  
This is an interesting concept of card. It certainly FEELS like a really Egyptian Curse, which is neat. I like that even though we've never had an explicitly Egyptian Block, there's a lot of cards in Magic that have an Egyptian/Dr. Fate kind of feel to them :)  
  
The problem with this card is that being of low converted mana cost, it encourages you to play it early, and that does hurt you much, and you really should never play this in Multiplayer.  
  
I think {3} is a great number to cast this for, since that could come down early if you have a plan to get around the two-edgedness, but if you don't have enough support and want to throw this down to stop ALL the lands and rely on the lands you have in play, then it's still castable early enough to hurt people... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Commenting on Every Card this Weekend! :D And commenting on Alpha cards really is fun. I need to eventually Draft Alpha. heck I don't care if you take the Power out-- Alpha Magic is just Cool and Fun even without $1000 dollar cards! :O

This is an interesting concept of card. It certainly FEELS like a really Egyptian Curse, which is neat. I like that even though we've never had an explicitly Egyptian Block, there's a lot of cards in Magic that have an Egyptian/Dr. Fate kind of feel to them :)

The problem with this card is that being of low converted mana cost, it encourages you to play it early, and that does hurt you much, and you really should never play this in Multiplayer.

I think {3} is a great number to cast this for, since that could come down early if you have a plan to get around the two-edgedness, but if you don't have enough support and want to throw this down to stop ALL the lands and rely on the lands you have in play, then it's still castable early enough to hurt people... posts.post_content:
I have an annoyingly rich friend who always runs the Zendikar search lands (e.g. [Misty Rainforest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Misty Rainforest)) with the Ravnica shock lands (e.g. [Stomping Ground](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stomping Ground)).  
  
I wanna see the look on his face when it takes him a total of 7 life to play a land, then he dies to a [Price of Progress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Price of Progress).
